meanings.definition: Insert (an extra day or month) in the calendar.
meanings.sent1: We will intercalate an extra day in February this year.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Romans used to intercalate days to adjust their calendar.
meanings.sent3: I forgot to intercalate the extra day, so now the calendar is off!
meanings.sent4: The idea to intercalate a leap year came to me in a dream.
meanings.sent5: Let's intercalate a special holiday to make this year memorable.

meanings.sent1: She will intercalate the colorful beads between the plain ones.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to intercalate small flowers in the painting.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally intercalated my keys between the sofa cushions.
meanings.sent4: His words intercalated with laughter, creating a joyful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The chef will intercalate layers of chocolate in the cake for a surprise.

meanings.definition: To insert (a gene or DNA sequence) into a chromosome.
meanings.sent1: Scientists aim to intercalate the new gene into the DNA strand.
meanings.sent2: The geneticist will intercalate the modified DNA sequence into the chromosome.
meanings.sent3: The experiment accidentally intercalated the wrong gene into the chromosome.
meanings.sent4: The breakthrough discovery allowed them to intercalate genes with precision.
meanings.sent5: The process to intercalate the gene required careful planning and execution.
